summary: This bill, the "Cross Border Aerial Law Enforcement Operations Act," directs the Secretary of Homeland Security to negotiate an agreement with Canada for integrated cross-border aerial law enforcement operations. It authorizes the establishment of a program involving various U.S. and Canadian law enforcement agencies, with a focus on operations within 50 miles of the border. The bill mandates training on privacy and civil liberties and requires reports to Congress on the program's progress and the use of unmanned aircraft systems along the border, including potential risks and jurisdictional issues. No additional funds are authorized.
